poem:
"Epicurean Shuffle Amidst The Pandemic"

Unguarded meals,
a call to dine,
unbreaded, unbriefed -
Oh, Downing Street!

Fragmented officials,
like puzzle pieces,
scattered in the bluster.

Warning lacked, 
a silent cry,
Simon Case, unversed
in the feast devised.

Amidst the chaos,
a strange impromptu dance,
the call to eat,
The gesture of hands,
extended, yet empty -
a paradox feast in pandemic fall.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Eat out to help out’ launched without telling official in charge, Covid inquiry hears The UK’s most senior civil servant has set out the chaos at the heart of Boris Johnson’s Downing Street, saying good officials were “just being smashed to pieces” while he was not warned in advance about the “eat out to help out” scheme. In a day of often damning testimony to the inquiry into the pandemic, Simon Case, the cabinet secretary,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
